country_overview.content: Greece, known for its ancient history, stunning islands, and rich cultural heritage, is a top destination for travelers. From the iconic Parthenon in Athens to the beautiful beaches of Santorini and Mykonos, Greece offers a unique blend of historical and natural attractions. As a member of the Schengen Area, Greece’s visa policies make it accessible to tourists, students, and business travelers, allowing them to explore the wonders of this Mediterranean country.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa
tourist_visa.description: The Schengen Tourist Visa allows visitors to stay in Greece and other Schengen countries for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. This visa is ideal for those traveling for leisure, sightseeing, or visiting family and friends.

business_visa.title: Business Visa
business_visa.description: The Schengen Business Visa permits individuals to travel to Greece for business purposes such as attending meetings, conferences, or negotiating contracts. This visa allows stays of up to 90 days within a 180-day period.

student_visa.title: Student Visa
student_visa.description: The Student Visa is for foreign nationals who wish to pursue education in Greece. This visa is generally issued for the duration of the academic program, with the option for renewal. Students may be permitted to work part-time during their studies.

work_visa.title: Work Visa
work_visa.description: The Work Visa is necessary for individuals who have secured employment in Greece. It allows for long-term residency and is usually tied to the employment contract. A Greek employer must sponsor this visa.

family_reunion_visa.title: Family Reunion Visa
family_reunion_visa.description: This visa allows family members of Greek citizens or residents to join them in Greece. It is typically issued for spouses, minor children, and dependent parents, with the sponsor in Greece required to demonstrate sufficient income and accommodation.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have a valid passport, proof of accommodation, sufficient financial means, and a clear purpose for visiting Greece. The intention to leave Greece before the visa expires must also be demonstrated.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Proof of accommodation (hotel bookings, invitation letter, etc.)
additional_documents: Proof of employment or studies in the home country

business_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must provide proof of their business activities in Greece, such as an invitation letter from a Greek company or organization, and demonstrate their intent to return to their home country.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Invitation letter from the Greek company
Proof of business activities (e.g., contracts, correspondence)
additional_documents: Previous business correspondence with the inviting company

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must be accepted into a Greek educational institution and demonstrate their ability to financially support their stay and studies in Greece.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Acceptance letter from the educational institution
Proof of financial support (e.g., bank statements)

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the appropriate visa type based on your purpose of travel to Greece. Ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria for the chosen visa category.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Review the specific eligibility requirements for the visa type you are applying for. This may include health checks, financial requirements, and documentation needs.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all necessary documents, including the visa application form, passport, photographs, and supporting documents relevant to your visa type.

step_4.title: Fill Out the Application Form
step_4.description: Complete the visa application form accurately. You can usually find the form on the official website of the Greek embassy or consulate in your country.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit your completed application form along with the required documents at the nearest Greek embassy or consulate. In some cases, online submission may be available.

step_6.title: Wait for Processing
step_6.description: The processing time varies depending on the visa type and your country of residence. Ensure that you provide any additional information if requested by the visa authorities.

step_7.title: Receive the Visa
step_7.description: Once your visa is approved, you will be notified to collect it. Ensure that all the details on the visa are correct before your travel.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees vary depending on the type of visa, the number of entries, and the nationality of the applicant. The fees are non-refundable and must be paid at the time of application. Fees can be paid online or through the embassy/consulate.

processing_time.content: Processing times for Greek visas generally range from 10 to 20 business days, depending on the type of visa and your country of residence. It is advisable to apply well in advance of your planned travel date.

visa_validity.content: The validity of a Greek visa depends on the type and number of entries allowed. For example, Schengen visas can be valid for 90 days within a 180-day period, while long-stay visas may be valid for several months or years, depending on the purpose.

entry_requirements.content: Upon arrival in Greece, travelers must present their valid visa, passport, and sometimes proof of accommodation and sufficient funds. It's essential to adhere to the entry requirements to avoid complications at the border.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in Greece?
faq_1.answer: Yes, certain visas can be extended while you are in Greece. You need to apply for an extension at the local Prefecture before your current visa expires.

faq_2.question: Is visa-free entry available for Greece?
faq_2.answer: Greece offers visa-free entry for citizens of certain countries, particularly within the EU/EEA and select other countries. However, most nationalities are required to obtain a visa prior to arrival.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Greece on a tourist visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a tourist visa is strictly prohibited. You must apply for a work visa if you intend to work in Greece legally.
